intro: Cremanthodium helianthus, commonly known as the golden cupflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that resemble small cups. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cremanthodium helianthus is often found in open areas with well-drained soil, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
